Seven figure transfer fees. Corruption all down the line. Violence on and off the pitch. Steroids. Got any concepts? It could be a thug story. I tell you what. Why don't you think about it. direction.raw_text: The untidy evidence. To the accompaniment of the music, a discordant version, three dog-eared copies of 'The Invention Of The Wheel', A Novel by JACK MANFRED. Worn furniture. A pile of literary magazines. Two elegantly arranged vases of flowers.  Women's fashion magazines. Books everywhere, including 'Scarne on Gambling', 'The Education of A Poker Player', 'Delta of Venus' and other books by Anais Nin. A woman's dress, back from the cleaners. A framed etching of Cape Town, South Africa, in the eighteenth century. Finally... Beneath the iron barred window, with a view of the iron steps down from the street, JACK sits at the dining table. In front of him is a word processor. He toys with a glass of vodka, smoking a Gitane, and leafing through a soccer fan magazine. He starts to touch-type, looking at the screen, not the keyboard. Words appear, letter by letter... THE BALL... A NOVEL... BY JACK MANFRED. He pauses to drink.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Detective Inspector Ross.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ross.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who did it? Tell me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We think it's a hit-and-run. A drunk driver, probably, But there is a possibility of a revenge killing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (distraught) Revenge? For what? Whose revenge?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As you know, she was a WPC with the Met. up until two years ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: fumbles in his pocket for a cigarette. There is a No Smoking sign on the wall. ROSS produces a Zippo and lights JACK'S Gitane.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: She called me last week. She'd got wind of a planned robbery at your casino.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What had that got to do with her death?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't recognise the man who attacked you, did you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (loudly) Of course I recognised him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) You did?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know a cheat when I see one. The man was a cheat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sighs, looks at MARION.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: suddenly reaches down and pulls the white sheet back over MARION'S face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Ross) Do you gamble?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is puzzled. JACK drops his cigarette on the floor, grinds it with his shoe. ROSS gives JACK his card.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If anything occurs to you, call me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: walks away from ROSS without a word. The DOCTOR is now filling out a form. From the door JACK looks back. ROSS waits for him to say something. JACK doesn't speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a REPRISE of JACK covering MARION'S face with the sheet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I was in love with her, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In his croupier's suit JACK walks the night streets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He passes a poster for the National Lottery bearing the legend: 'IT COULD BE YOU'. JACK doesn't see it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quoting) 'The world breaks everyone, and afterward many are strong at the broken places. But those that will not break, it kills. It kills the very good and the very gentle and the very brave impartially. If you are none of these, you can be sure it will kill you too but there will be no special hurry'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: smashes a plate over a MAN'S head. It's plate- smashing party time, Greek-style. TWENTY drunk PEOPLE having fun. Zorba music. Plates are thrown, stamped on, smashed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits alone at a corner table, drinking, watching the fun, unsmiling. One plate cracks into a wall behind him. A MAN stumbles backwards into JACK's table. JACK swiftly moves his drink out of the way. The MAN apologises, turns to JACK. It is MATT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jacko! How're you doing? (shakes Jack's hand vigorously) I heard about the raid. Pity they didn't pull it off. I wish I'd been there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: has to shout above the noise and music. JACK smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) But you were there Matt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: doesn't hear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What? You know what happened to me, don't you? That bitch Bella shopped me. I'd like to beat the shit out of her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to buy you a drink.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cheers. Happy New Year. I really like you, Jacko, you're so fucking straight. (suddenly) Hey, you haven't changed your clothes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: There are four or five PEOPLE left among the debris. MATT has gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is still there, drunk now.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The music stopped, Jack was drunk... hallucinating. He was back, as a child, in the Wild Coast Casino.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: comes over to him. Her name is LUCY.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You've been avoiding me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (blearily) Have I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm Lucy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what do you do, Lucy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm a witch. A white witch. Why don't we move on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you going to put a spell on me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I might.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: guides JACK to a parked car. He is drunker than she. When he sees the car he starts to laugh. It is his Austin Healey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She opens the door for him. They climb in. LUCY starts the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They drive off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nice car. How much did you pay for it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Too much. Eighteen hundred.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where to?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Turn left at the lights.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A deserted intersection. The Austin Healey swings around a corner.  A WOMAN steps out from the kerb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reacts. He swings the wheel. LUCY shouts. The car swerves, missing the WOMAN.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! I saw her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks back. The WOMAN is shouting after the car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You don't trust women drivers, do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jack didn't trust anyone. Except himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sits at his computer. He is watching the printer unloading page after page. JACK assembles the typescript.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It was finally finished. He thought of sending it to Giles. But that wouldn't be right. He would select a publisher at random, like a number.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: UP: The dedication: 'To Marion'. The sound of the ball bouncing against the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ball falls into 10. JACK puts the doll on 10. No one at the table has the winning number. JACK sweeps away the losing bets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blackjack table. The bets are placed. JACK turns over the bank's cards: a KING and an ACE. He takes all the chips from the five PUNTERS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Jack) You're wasting yourself. With your luck you ought to come over to our side.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: ALL HERE, THE SYSTEMS, THE SCAMS, THE SLEAZE

direction.raw_text: . BOOKSTORE - NIGHT JACK comes up to a bookstore window. A sticker reads: 'IT'S A WINNER'. There are quotes blown up from the reviews: "AN INCREDIBLE INSIDE JOB...IT'S ALL HERE, THE SYSTEMS, THE SCAMS, THE SLEAZE...A TALE OF TRIUMPHANT DISGUST...OF EXHILARATING CONTEMPT..." The display is just one book: 'I, CROUPIER'. Number 1 Bestseller.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Even his publisher had no idea who the author was. He had done the deal through a lawyer. It gave him a good feeling, no one knowing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is reading the book. He laughs out loud at something.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...It never occurred to anyone at the Casino that the Golden Lion had been his model. Why should it? Weren't all casinos the same....
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is sitting in his croupier's suit on the crowded tube. He sees a WOMAN reading 'I, CROUPIER'. For the first time we see the back cover...'by ANONYMOUS'.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...It gave him an exquisite pleasure, being an underground man. With all his money, he hadn't even bought a car. Jack knew the truth about himself, he was a one- book writer. A one time winner who had quit while he was ahead...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Five in the morning.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He changed nothing in the flat, bought nothing, spent nothing. The only thing he did was to remove the bars outside the window...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: comes in. The phone rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CASINO - NIGHT JANI is holding a mobile phone. In the background is the casino room, the lights, colours, rattling sounds. She waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hesitates, then picks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The following conversation is INTERCUT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jack! It's Jani.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jani! Where are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sun City. I've been meaning to call you for months.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) How are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Great. I'm getting married. At least, I think I am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you solve your problems?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I'm all over that now. Jack, hold on a minute. There's someone here who wants to talk to you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: waits.

direction.raw_text: hand takes the phone from JANI.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacko - how're you doing?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dad!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . his arm round JANI, talks into the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I never thanked you properly for your help. Jani told me you behaved like a perfect gentleman throughout. I knew you would. I know my son.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: face is a mask, tight, fixed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The woman thinks I'm going to marry her. But you know me. It's a shame things didn't work out. But we saw you all right. You didn't gamble the ten grand, did you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (huskily) As a matter of fact I did. But I won.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's my boy. How's that novel of yours coming along?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: slowly puts the phone down. He takes a deep breath. Then smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So that was it. The final card. Blackjack. His father, eight thousand miles and twenty seven years away, was still dealing to his son Jack from the bottom of the deck...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He drinks at a gulp. He turns. Standing in the doorway is BELLA, wearing a nightdress. She is sleepy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: To you. To both of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you laughing at? Who was that on the phone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A couple I know are getting married.

direction.raw_text: puts her arms around him lovingly.

dialogue.raw_text: Fools.

direction.raw_text: We are back in the FIRST SCENE. The ball bounces around the spinning wheel. The FACES of the PUNTERS. Frozen expressions. They are almost still. We do not see the croupier. Then...

direction.raw_text: Nothing moves except the little white ball in the spinning wheel. The ball slows...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now he had reached the point where he no longer heard the sound of the ball...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...the spin of the wheel had brought him home to the place where he was born.

direction.raw_text: face. A hint of a smile.

dialogue.raw_text: The croupier's mission was accomplished.

dialogue.raw_text: At last he was Master of the Game. He had aquired the power... to make you lose.
